se.softhouse.common.testlib

Class Locales

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.softhouse.common.testlib.Locales

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class Locales
extends Object
     Utilities for testing different Locales.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Locale SWEDISH
      The Locale representing Sweden
      static Locale TURKISH
      See Turkish Java Needs Special Brewing and What's Wrong With Turkey? for more details about why the Turkish Locale is suitable for testing purposes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Locale resetDefaultLocale()
      Resets Locale.getDefault() to what it was when setDefault(Locale) was called.
      static Locale setDefault(Locale locale)
      Makes it possible to test invalid usages of Locale.getDefault() in a synchronized manner making sure that test cases don't fail suddenly when they are run concurrently.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • SWEDISH

        public static final Locale SWEDISH
        The Locale representing Sweden

      • TURKISH

        public static final Locale TURKISH
        See Turkish Java Needs Special Brewing and What's Wrong With Turkey? for more details about why the Turkish Locale is suitable for testing purposes.

    • Method Detail

      • resetDefaultLocale

        public static Locale resetDefaultLocale()
        Resets Locale.getDefault() to what it was when setDefault(Locale) was called. Should be called after you're done with using Locale.getDefault().
        Returns:
        the default Locale that was set
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this thread wasn't the last one to successfully call setDefault(Locale)

      • setDefault

        public static Locale setDefault(Locale locale)
                         throws InterruptedException
          Makes it possible to test invalid usages of Locale.getDefault() in a synchronized
  manner making sure that test cases don't fail suddenly when they are run concurrently.
  I.e a pipelined version of Locale.getDefault().

 Note: Don't forget to call resetDefaultLocale() when you're done with using
 the Locale.getDefault() method. Otherwise other threads waiting to use it may starve.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale Locale.getDefault() should return
        Returns:
        the previous default locale
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted
